description.narrative: The project''s overall objective is to support the Government''s strategy to increase national agricultural productivity and farm income. Its specific objective is to improve the effectiveness of the national agricultural technology system in Bangladesh for the benefit of small and marginal farmers. The project has a major policy reform agenda, which includes amendment of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Council (BARC) Act 1996; establishment of an autonomous agricultural research foundation (the Krishi Gobeshona Foundation); and decentralization of agricultural extension funding, planning and services to the upazila level. This agenda will be continued during implementation. Possible future reforms required prior to proceeding to subsequent phases of the project could include reorganization of BARC, and fiduciary and budget reforms for agricultural research and extension. During implementation, the project will also assist the Government in updating its agricultural extension and fisheries extension policies, and in preparing a new national livestock extension policy.
This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
